Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Meet the Smart Safety Company
At Safe Fleet our name says it all. We make fleet vehicles – and everyone in and around them – safer. Our fleet safety platform brings together best-in-class products, ground-breaking technology, and a 100-year history of fleet know-how and innovation to solve the world’s biggest fleet safety problems.
Our core value is safety. Without safety first, efficiency and productivity are not possible. This is true for our products, our culture, and our relationship with our community. Our vision is to reduce preventable deaths and injuries in and around fleet vehicles with a goal of ZERO accidents.
We are re-defining what safety means for fleets of every type – from school buses to waste collection trucks, firefighting to utility vehicles, police cruisers to delivery vans.
Whether you work in our Charlotte plant to build life-saving stop arms for school buses, or design advanced camera vision products in our Vancouver office, forge valves and high-quality nozzles to fight fires, or dream up new ways to protect fleet operators in our Corporate HQ in Kansas City, you’ll contribute to our goal to keep everyone safe.
We are a fast-growing manufacturing, service, and technology company with over 1700 employees in over 15 locations across Canada and the US. We’re looking for motivated self-starters with innovative thinking to join our team and help us achieve our growth and performance goals. Sound like you?
Compensation is base salary. We also offer paid vacation time, sick/personal days and fully paid benefits after 3 months’ probation (Life, Accidental Death & Disability, Short and Long-Term Disability, Extended Health, Dental, Employee Assistance Program and RRSP Program with company matching your contributions, up to 3% of your salary).
As our
Digital Marketing Specialist
, you will be responsible for planning, creating, testing, communicating and reporting on email and marketing automation programs to grow demand pipelines, nurture leads, and convert leads to customers for the Video Group of Safe Fleet; you will work with the marketing team to understand the target audience, how they buy, and their buying criteria to develop timely, effective multi-channel marketing campaigns.
You will
Manage all aspects of the marketing automation platform (Pardot) including creating email templates, building lists, forms, landing pages, and workflows, maintaining database hygiene, and developing lead scoring and lead nurturing campaigns
Collaborate with the marketing team to create engaging email copy, digital ads, webinars, and effective landing pages based to drive high-quality leads to meet pipeline and revenue goals
Built complex nurture and triggered email campaigns to encourage product awareness, education, and adoption
Use email best practices to create and test email templates to ensure effective delivery, open, and click-through rates
Work with sales and marketing team to understand the sales cycle, develop messaging and content as appropriate, and ensure efficient, effective lead workflow, distribution and follow-up
Implement lead scoring programs to accurately identify sales readiness
Establish metrics for lead generation and build, maintain, and manage reports and dashboards to track ROI of marketing activities, campaign effectiveness, pipeline contribution, and overall business performance
Work with web developer to track and increase website conversions and execute personalization campaigns
Execute on Google AdWords, Facebook, LinkedIn and other digital ad campaigns
You should have
Minimum 3 years of proven experience developing successful email marketing and demand generation programs for a B2B brand using
Pardot
, Salesforce.com or equivalent CRM/marketing automation platform
Demonstrated knowledge of marketing databases, segmentation, email execution, lead handling, lead nurturing, reporting and analysis
Great understanding what drives conversions across markets and channels (paid search, organic search, social, display and email) to maximize campaign performance
Experience with set up and ongoing management of SEO, Google AdWords, social media ads and other paid search campaigns
Excellent verbal and written communications; with experience developing compelling sales-oriented email copy
If you were considered for an interview, you will be asked to provide some examples of your work that had produced results.

Title: Digital Marketing Strategist - Canada - Indeed.com
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada, and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
The primary focus of this role is to contribute to the growth and development of our digital marketing offering. Reporting to the Manager, Triangle Retail Media, this position will ensure our new department is successfully implementing new vendors, products, and optimizing client relations and cross functional operations
What you’ll do:
Support cross banner campaigns and champion a customer-focused culture to develop client relationships across internal and external stakeholders
Act as a liaison with clients regarding new product launches and digital advertising opportunities. Have a deep understanding of how Triangle Retail Media’s products and services can help grow the client’s business and meet their needs
Lead, develop and implement various projects to on-board new vendors and products. This will include developing project schedules, project milestones, project deliverables and budgets, progress tracking, key performance indicators as part of an integrated program management team
Support the Manager and Associate Manager of Operations in new process development and documentation
Project management support to team members, help facilitate the removal of barriers, and ensure requirements are met and delivered in a timely manner
Support in determine project scope, objectives, benefits, feasibility and cost and time requirements of new vendors and projects
Coordinate and work with Ecomm, Marketing, IT and Digital Operation teams on cross-functional initiatives
Work with external vendors and consultants to develop solutions to meet Triangle Retail Media requirements across all banners
Develop and manage contract documents including RFPs, change order controls, purchase orders, and invoicing
What you bring
We are looking for high performing individuals who are and have:
2-3 years experience in digital marketing planning or execution
Strong project management skills and experience with the ability to influence cross functional and supplier teams to perform against scope, schedule, and budget milestones
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, Commerce or Economics
Strong time management skills along with well-developed analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Experience with vendors like Google, Facebook, Pinterest, TikTok, Salesforce, Criteo, Bloomreach, & Adobe considered an asset
Strong process orientation with experience in process development and improvement
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) and the ability to influence, negotiate, and develop relationships at all levels of the organization
Effective at collaborating with key stakeholders at all levels of the organization and with external partners to implement change.
Good PC skills with MS Access, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and MS Project
About Canadian Tire Corporation
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies .
To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn .
CTR Marketing
Ontario-Toronto
Permanent
Full-time
Job Posting

Title: Digital Marketing Coordinator (Remote) - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
We’re Ada, a brand interaction platform that empowers brands to live up to their promises and have more—and more valuable—interactions with the people who love them. Our AI-powered platform has automated over 1 billion brand interactions for the world’s fastest growing enterprises, including Zoom, Facebook, and Shopify. We recently raised Series C funding of $130M by Spark Capital (early investors of Twitter, Slack, Snapchat), and we're officially a Canadian unicorn with a $1.2B valuation!
The passion of our people and dedication to their craft continues to drive our dramatic global growth.
Our work is rooted in authenticity, courage, empathy, and simplicity. We use these values to create a culture that encourages groundbreaking results, career progression, and community investment. You can learn more about the founding of our company here.
We are inspired every day by the opportunity to pioneer a new industry, and welcome those who want to join us
.
Ada is looking for a Digital Marketing Coordinator to join the Demand Generation team to help drive our business forward by supporting the team on executing demand generation activities. This person will be primarily responsible for deploying new content and supporting channel managers with the goal of optimizing channels, generating new MQLs, and growing pipeline.
About You
You have 1-2 years of digital marketing (SaaS preferred) experience with all or most of the following: HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Analytics, etc.
You are comfortable managing and prioritizing multiple projects simultaneously.
You have excellent writing and editing skills which will help you create effective long form marketing content to reinforce Ada’s value proposition.
You are willing to learn about new marketing channels and strategies, and work in a fast-paced startup environment.
You are a self-starter who can take action with minimal supervision and consistently deliver against deadlines and goals.
You love to experiment and think outside of the box.
You are excited to make an immediate impact and contribute to hitting team goals, and look to always improve performance.
Outcomes
Manage and optimize the intake, creation and deployment of content in support of Ada’s brand and campaign teams.
Support the execution of Ada’s email marketing initiatives through HubSpot or similar marketing automation tools.
Contribute to the growth of organic traffic month over month.
Collaborate with channel and campaign managers to understand overall strategy and how to increase conversion rates across all channels.
Leverage data to make optimizations that will drive better conversion rates at every stage of the marketing funnel.
Report frequently on landing page performance and understand levers to pull to optimize against our goals.
#LI-IM1
Benefits
Competitive salary and generous stock option plan
Unlimited vacation
Wellness account
Extended health coverage
Dental/optical/travel insurance
Life insurance
Employee and family assistance plan
Perks
Flexible work schedule
Digital first, fully remote with WFH budget
In-house social worker
Paid parental leave for Canadian and U.S. residents
Development opportunities
About Us
Ada is a rapidly growing digital first company in a thriving AI ecosystem. We optimize our communication, collaboration, and work ethic for the digital world instead of in-person. We are building the workplace of the future to build the customer experience of the future. With flexible working hours, together we'll determine a schedule that fits your style and the requirements of your role.
We are backed by world-class investors, including Spark, Accel, FirstMark, Bessemer Venture Partners, and Version One. We provide our employees with competitive compensation, great health benefits, and ownership in our company.
With the health and safety of Ada's employees, clients and communities top of mind, effective December 1st, 2021, Ada will be requiring anyone who is traveling for work and attending Ada events to be fully vaccinated at least 2 weeks prior to travel.
Ada is an equal opportunity employer. In fact, diversity is what drives our success—it’s at the core of how we hire, communicate, and work. Like our platform, we are inclusive to all, and combine our diverse backgrounds, skill sets and thinking to build the best experiences for our clients and their customers.

Title: Part-time Digital Marketing Coordinator - London, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Posting Number
40262
Requisition Title
Part-time Digital Marketing Coordinator
Internal Posting Closing Date
External Closing Date
Open Until Filled
Yes
Campus Location
London
Department
Marketing (MAC)
Employment Group
Support
Pay Details
$25.52 per hour
Hours of Work per Week
Up to 24 hours per week.
Summary
Working at Fanshawe College
In support of a healthy campus to learn, live and work, Fanshawe College moved the majority of our Academic, Support and Administrative operations online to curb the spread of COVID-19. Today, the majority of these services continue to be delivered remotely, however as public health guidelines allow for more in-person services, Fanshawe College has begun welcoming our community back for on-campus activities.
As an employee of Fanshawe College you may be required to work on-campus, remotely, or a combination thereof. Confirmation of your work location will be clarified with you upon hire, and may be subject to change based on the duties required of your position.
Fanshawe College strongly believes the key to maintaining a healthy campus and community, and to protect each other, is to adhere to all public health guidelines, including vaccination.
As of November 5, 2021, Fanshawe College requires all students, staff, and visitors to all campuses to be fully vaccinated in order to attend the campus in-person.
For those individuals that medically cannot be vaccinated, please advise us when contacted for an interview and arrangements can be made to participate virtually.
Note:
This is a part-time temporary position (up to 24 hours per week) until July 1, 2022.
Duties:
Coordinate, develop and execute digital content marketing plans for both paid and organic promotion of the College, targeting various audiences, to increase awareness, drive conversions and generate/nurture leads. Under the direction of the Senior Marketing Manager, the incumbent will collaborate with marketing, communications, CRM and creative staff, as well as other stakeholders across the organization. The ideal candidate has excellent verbal, written and presentation skills, understands the basics of paid and organic digital marketing techniques, is data-driven, and has a passion for marketing.
Other Duties Include:
Coordinate and execute digital marketing plans for various audiences, examples include a digital content marketing plan, lead generation campaigns, or lead nurture campaigns
Collate and conduct industry research, benchmarking, competitive scans for planning purposes
Assist with website audit, keyword research and updating webpages based on SEO recommendations in our Drupal CMS
Create or collaborate with other teams to produce content including copywriting, writing for the web, writing for email marketing, basic video (mobile only), etc.
Support RBM teams with various tasks across functions – marketing, communications and web
Communicate campaign objectives, timelines, instructions for use or promotion, and deliverables to various stakeholders
Track and report key performance metrics using data analytics tools to drive traffic and optimize lead generation
Conduct digital campaign testing, such as A/B or multivariate testing, to maximize click-through and conversions
Work closely with various departments and stakeholders to ensure alignment with marketing objectives and to develop targeted campaigns
Attend professional development webinars and workshops to further develop marketing knowledge and share learnings with other members of the Marketing team
Other projects, duties and initiatives as assigned
Qualifications
Post-secondary 3-year diploma or degree in Marketing, Communications or related discipline
Minimum 3 years’ of work experience in a Marketing Coordinator or similar position
An equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered; preference will be given to applicants meeting the education requirements
Google AdWords and Google Analytics certification, or commitment to complete, is considered an asset
Hands-on experience with running campaigns across Google, Facebook, etc., including keyword research and audience targeting
Experience or familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite, video editing, website updating, Google AdWords, Search Console, Keyword Planner and Analytics is an asset
Knowledge of traditional, digital, content and social media marketing
Understanding of brand, tone, stakeholders and target audiences
Working knowledge or experience with the following: email marketing, segmentation, workflows, forms, landing pages, performance reporting, paid advertising, social media, content management and Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
Proven ability to perform research, analyze data, derive actionable insights and present on findings
Comfortable sharing ideas, asking questions and is open to constructive feedback
Good time management skills in a remote environment, ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong interpersonal, written and oral skills
Excellent attention to detail and a high motivation to learn
Problem solving and critical thinking skills with the ability to organize and communicate data
How to Apply:
PLEASE
SUBMIT
YOUR
COVER
LETTER
AND
RESUME
VIA
EMAIL
(quoting Competition No.
MAC
40262) TO:
Courtney Ecker
Senior Manager, Marketing
Fanshawe College
Email: cecker@fanshawec.ca
General Information
While transcripts are not required for the interview, they are mandatory prior to any offer of employment.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be acknowledged.
Fanshawe College is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equity, value diversity, and welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds.
Fanshawe College provides accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. If a job applicant requires an accommodation during the application process or through the selection process, the hiring manager and the Recruitment Coordinator leading the recruitment will work with the applicant to meet the job applicant’s accommodation needs.

Members of the Contract Teaching Faculty bargaining unit:
During this time of remote learning environment, the PTACs do not have access to Official Files. If there are documents you submitted to your Official File you would like the PTAC to use in the review of your application, you will need to include those documents when applying for positions.
All job postings will be for in-person teaching, unless they are indicated "OC" for Online Course or "Remote" for remote teaching. OC and Remote teaching is defined below.
Courses created specifically for online instruction have been collaboratively designed by a content expert (normally a faculty member) and an instructional designer and digital media and educational technology specialists. Online course development is guided by instructional design strategies and makes use of pedagogically led technology. Online courses are intentionally developed for instructors and students to be separated by space (location) and/or time (often both).
Remote instruction, as the term is used here, uses technology-enabled tools and software to facilitate course delivery when in-person instruction is not possible in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. "Remote" instruction is not directly comparable to "online course" instruction. The difference is not in the quality of the content, but in the design of content delivery.
In-person fall teaching will be supported by classroom safety and hygiene protocols aligned with public health guidelines in effect at the time and will adhere to any COVID-19 related university policies including the COVID-19 face covering policy. Questions related to classroom safety protocols can be directed to SHERM (shermcovid19@wlu.ca). Questions related to employment accommodation needs can be directed to the confidential Health & Abilities team in Human Resources cgruhl@wlu.ca.
Should you be interested in learning more about this opportunity, please visit
www.wlu.ca/careers
_ for additional information and the online application system. All applications must be submitted online. Please note, a CV and letter of introduction will be required in electronic form._

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
About Canada Drives
We asked Canadians what they hated most about car shopping—and then we fixed it. Canada Drives has reinvented the dealership experience for the 21st century!
As the nation’s largest 100% online vehicle retailing and delivery platform, Canadians can shop hundreds of certified used cars and have their vehicle delivered to their doorstep with a click of a button.
An industry-challenging company since day one, Canada Drives is breaking new ground at the intersection of e-commerce and automotive. We value innovation, creativity, and out-of-the-box thinking, and we’re looking for high-energy pioneers to help us do things that have never been done before.
It’s been a hugely exciting year for Canada Drives with the national launch of our online car sales platform (as seen on CTV news), and we don’t plan on slowing down anytime soon. The recent TechCrunch announcement of $100 million in funding means we can continue to rapidly grow our team and expand to new markets.
The automotive industry was stagnating but big changes are happening. Be a part of it—explore marketing opportunities with Canada Drives. Career-defining moments lie ahead...
What You’ll Be Doing:
Managing winning digital ad campaigns; including keyword/market/competitor research, segment and placement inclusions & exclusions, ad copy & ad design recommendations, etc.
Manage reports that summarize ad campaign outcomes, analyze data and provide recommendations based on desired KPI’s.
Researching and setting up new Ad platforms, setting up campaign tracking and conducting quality assurance checks.
Managing and leveraging relationships with Ad platform representatives.
Identifying and troubleshooting technical problems in a timely manner.
What You Should Already Have:
5+ years of successfully managing online display campaigns (i.e. Facebook, AdWords Display) or Search Engine Marketing experience (i.e. AdWords Search, Bing).
Deep knowledge of ad serving technologies, the latest online advertising concepts and rich media creative.
Up-to-date knowledge of best practices, strategies and latest developments in many facets of online advertising.
Experience working with DSP’s, Ad Exchanges, RTB platforms is an asset, but not required.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
What we offer:
An opportunity to work for one of Canada’s top emerging companies
Human and technical resources to assist optimization across the entire marketing landscape
Competitive salary with opportunities for raises and advancement
Extended Health Benefits (Health, Life, and Dental)
Regularly scheduled performance evaluations and ongoing career development opportunities
Work from home (until Sept 2021 and possibly beyond) or in office (next to the Burrard Skytrain Station in Downtown Vancouver).

Title: Lead, Digital Products - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is currently recruiting for an IT Lead, Digital Products within the Digital Product Line. This position’s primary location will be Toronto, Ontario.
At Janssen, we’re creating a future where disease is a thing of the past.
We’re the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, working tirelessly to make that future a reality for patients everywhere by fighting sickness with science, improving access with ingenuity, and healing hopelessness with heart. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.
We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. As part of Johnson & Johnson, Our Credo guides us.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Our Digital Product organization is uniquely positioned to connect our purpose driven, science-backed products and services for our consumers, patients, healthcare professionals and customers around the world. By powering personalized, omni-channel experiences, we strengthen engagement, uncover insights into disease and drive growth. Working in close partnership with our wider Technology organization and business, we develop and scale smarter, faster and more efficient future-ready digital platforms, capabilities and connected ecosystems that enable innovation to enhance health at every life stage.
The Lead, Digital Products will provide IT oversight of the creation and ongoing management of all digital products (websites, campaigns, mobile applications) within their given therapeutic area. This role serves as the main interface between the business and development teams and handles a portfolio of digital products. In addition, this individual holds broad strategic and operational responsibilities within the following areas:
Specific responsibilities include:
Business analysis and solutioning
Collaborate across multiple teams to identify digital products that will solve business needs
Serve as domain expert with ability to explain how requirements may be implemented from a functional standpoint
Provide input and guidance to platform teams on new capabilities required
Product development
Engage the business regarding development needs for digital products
Write, handle and clarify user stories; prioritize product backlog; develop use cases for complex requirements
Support agile processes by participating in sprint planning and ensuring deliverables are available for upcoming sprints
Document user acceptance testing and satisfaction of business requirements.
Stakeholder Management
Assess, measure and communicate expected outcomes in terms of user engagement, business impact, etc, and utilize digital metrics & analytics to assess and report on value delivery as required.
Perform impact analysis of new releases and deployments and leads all related communications
Issue regular and clear communications on schedules, deadlines and interdependencies
Work with Technology Services (TS) teams on demand planning, effort, timing, delivery and support of new demand
Cultivate collaborative, healthy, inclusive, and credo-based culture of highly engaged, robust teams by modeling credo values, valuing diverse perspectives
Product Portfolio Management
Manage lifecycle of products and execute on upgrade/decommissioning as appropriate
Manage and monitor the health of all products in portfolio and proactively identifies and actions support issues
Manage lifecycle of products and recommend upgrade/decommissioning as appropriate
Develop & evolve product strategy and roadmap by staying ahead of technology advancements, working closely with architecture teams, and continuously exploring innovative opportunities to shape analytics products
Qualifications
Requirements:
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required and six (6) years of digital experience
Experience documenting requirements, writing user stories and working with agile teams
Digital domain expertise including modern web platforms, web content management and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems.
Superb communication and consultative skills including the ability to clearly and effectively communicate and present findings
Demonstrated ability to collaborate successfully and build relationships with brand marketing teams, IT colleagues, agency partners and technology vendors.
Preferences:
Experience in pharmaceutical or life sciences industry and/or managing a high volume of digital marketing activity
Familiarity with digital analytics platforms & value assessments
Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Knowledge of commercial pharma compliance & regulatory processes
This position’s primary location will be on site in Toronto, Ontario. At times, this position may require travel to NJ/PA.

Title: Digital Content Consultant - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Req ID: 20582
Vacancy Type: Permanent
Number of Positions: 1
Closing Date: 12/03/2021
Job summary
The City of Mississauga has an opportunity for a senior level digital content writer to join our Digital Strategy and Experience Team. The successful applicant will design website content for Mississauga.ca and deliver digital content strategies and implementation to internal business service areas. Using strong research and best practices for digital in public and private sector organizations, the successful applicant will provide consultation and leadership on matters related to writing for the web, content management, style guides, and customer-centric methodologies.
About the team
The Digital Strategy and Experience Team is working with people across our organization to make the City's online services and information simpler, clearer and faster for citizens and businesses. We're all about focusing on the customer, designing with evidence, and measuring our results. We work collaboratively and iteratively, so you'll be expected to work with our entire team, on many or all of our projects, sometimes on short notice. That means working with developers, designers, subject matter experts, and senior management - anyone we need to, to help us produce world-class online services.
About you
As a Digital Content Consultant, you understand the art and science of writing for the web. You are a versatile writer, a seasoned editor, and a proven online content expert with considerable experience using customer insights. You are web savvy, and accustomed to working alongside technical and creative staff on large scale digital initiatives.
Duties and responsibilities
Working alongside a team of content designers, you will be responsible for developing and executing digital content plans that support initiatives that create great customer experiences. You will lead the planning, writing, and activation of accessible, user-focused content on hundreds of topics, while developing and implementing new City-wide standards for content style and governance. This position will require up to 50% of time spent on writing and editing projects.
You'll need to:
Scope, write, edit and deliver digital content about complex topics that is clear, optimized for the web and supports customer journeys and business goals
Develop and design web content that adheres to industry best practices (SEO, accessibility, plain language) and aligns with Mississauga’s Digital Strategy
Provide leadership and consultation that supports a customer-centric approach; discover customer and stakeholder expectations and priorities, and develop content to meet the needs that the public has of Government
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and maintain corporate standards and procedures related to web writing, content management, and style guides for official City Government website content
Provide coaching, training, leadership and guidance to departmental teams for matters related to digital content design, and enhance knowledge of corporate content standards with a wide variety of internal stakeholders
Analyze Voice of the Customer feedback and utilize quality assurance tools to ensure digital content focuses on user needs and experience
Demonstrate the ability to effectively proof-read, edit, and provide approvals of other editors' content in a collaborative and diplomatic manner
Initiate and manage projects to implement the Digital Strategy, in partnership with the appropriate City staff and representatives and stakeholders from other City Departments
Report on website performance as it relates to content optimization
Be an advocate for Corporate Business Services Division to train and develop colleagues into great web writers.
Skills and Qualifications
University degree or diploma in digital communications, journalism, digital marketing or related field
Minimum of seven years progressive business experience with a proven track record in digital communications; preferably with a focus on customer experience in a large corporate or government setting
Experience leading editorial strategy for information, transactional sites or business verticals
Power user who has personal and professional experience in all facets of web
Excellent editorial skills including producing proposals and content briefs, writing accessible content for diverse audiences, proof-reading and copy-editing, and creating editorial guidelines and documentation
Extensive experience writing for digital projects involving complex topics, conducting site content audits, writing project plans, and repurposing content to tight deadlines
Experience in working with WordPress and other content publishing systems
Knowledge of using customer feedback to improve or refine web page content through user surveys analytics tools
Highly developed conflict resolution, project management, time management, organizational, inter-personal and problem-solving skills
Portfolio of projects that demonstrate your ability to structure and optimize online information, and write great content for the web in plain English
We also would like you to have:
The ability to lead project meetings; gain consensus for your strategies; and drive actionable outcomes
Understanding of information architecture, user experience testing, iterative, agile methodologies
#LI-CPS

Hours of Work: 35
Work Location: Civic Centre

before their first day
.

Title: Growth Marketing Manager - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
We are looking for a
Growth Marketing Manager
who will be instrumental in driving new business and sales pipeline to the sales team.
This position can be remote based in Canada or USA.
The Growth Marketing Manager is a data-driven yet creative individual who assists in driving growth in the sales pipeline by planning and executing digital advertising campaigns, ABM campaigns, social media campaigns, and more.
Reporting to the Head of Growth, you will be interacting on a daily basis with the sales, content marketing, and product marketing teams. The Demand Generation team at Epiphan is a fully remote, highly agile, and performance-driven team that uses a very robust marketing technology stack for planning, execution, and analytics, including tools such as Salesforce, Drift, ActiveCampaign, Apollo, and more.
This role is a good fit for those who are comfortable working in a highly dynamic environment and pushing the envelope of what’s possible. The ideal candidate is someone who can work autonomously and desires to master their domain knowledge while maintaining a good work-life balance and working for an established company. While this position is fully remote, you must be open to occasional travel for activities such as team building and industry events.
Key responsibilities
Identifying opportunities and developing inbound marketing campaigns that drive results
Building outbound contact lists, ideating, and executing outbound campaigns including ABM campaigns
Developing, implementing, and optimizing global campaigns, webinars, events, and other programs that drive results and deliver business priority objectives while building new strategies for lead generation
Working cross-functionally to plan and execute best-in-class, integrated, data-driven marketing campaigns across paid media, social, SEO, digital, web, email, webinars, events, and more
Running experiments and setting objectives for improvements in the lead pipeline
Carrying a quota for generated marketing and sales qualified leads
Authoring content for digital marketing campaigns, including preparing ad copy as well as written content for campaigns
Analyzing inbound campaigns, looking for gaps and improvements, conducting A/B testing
Maintenance of Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads, YouTube Ads, and various other digital ad platforms
Continually monitoring and iterating on campaign efforts after launch to optimize and drive incremental leads
Experience and qualifications
3+ years of experience in digital marketing preferred
Experience with digital marketing and growth projects from ideation to completion
Experience with experimentation frameworks and strategies such as A/B testing at a high volume
Experience with Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and other digital marketing tools
Strong writing skills and disciplined documentation process
Experience in a performance marketing role
Experience at a B2B company
Experience and knowledge of SEO
Self-starter, self-motivated, able to work independently, strong entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit
High level of creativity and ability to think outside the box
Highly organized, analytical, and process-driven
Strong English language verbal and written communication skills
You
must have existing authorization to live & work in Canada or the USA
. Applicants currently not living in Canada/ the USA will not be considered.
How to Apply:
Please forward applications via email only to
careers @ epiphan .com
including a cover letter and resume. In the e-mail subject line, please indicate the position title
Growth Marketing Manager
. We thank all applicants for their interest, but we will only be able to contact individuals being invited for an interview. No agencies please.

Title: Marketing Coordinator - Barrie, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Who Are We?
Based in ON, Canada, Suits Social is a young, modern, and highly effective digital marketing agency founded in 2015. We've recently gone full-remote and all of our staff now work from home, and can live anywhere in Ontario!
This means two things:
No more commuting in rush hour!
No more filling up with $2/L gas every few days.
And most important of all (thanks to Zoom), you'll only need to purchase nice clothes from the waist up. Just kidding... but not really.
Seriously though, times are changing (in case you haven't noticed) and we're committed to developing a digital first experience for both our staff and clients as we evolve into a new era of marketing and business.
What We Do!
Suits Social works with businesses across Canada and North America, to plan and execute profitable digital marketing campaigns on platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Google, Email, etc. Our goal is to help businesses build their brand awareness, generate more leads and acquire new customers profitably online with a system that scales!
Get in on the ground floor of something HUGE!
We are building a world-class team of people who like to be challenged and want to grow into leaders of a nationally known agency. You'll get plenty of opportunity to work and learn from a seasoned team of digital marketing experts, as well as directly with the founder of Suits Social Darren Cabral.
As a newer agency, new roles and opportunities are created every year. That means if you're willing to work hard, put your head down, and get sh*t done... they'll be plenty of room for growth over the next 5-10 years. We're in it for the long haul and are looking for candidates who feel the same. If that sounds like you, we want to talk!
What kind of person are we looking for?
We are looking for a passionate individual with high energy, high intelligence, and an abundance of common sense and/or street smarts. We're also looking for someone willing to contribute new ideas towards the consistant improvement and growth of the company, our processes and our systems.
To succeed at this role you'll need to have a positive can-do attitude AT ALL TIMES, and be a "likeable" team player. You need to be able to manage many projects and tasks, and be able to change direction at a moments notice as our agency and clients are constantly changing and we have to be willing to do the same. Most importantly, you need to be self-motivated.
Suits Social is looking for a passionate digital marketer who lives and breathes digital marketing and social media. What we are looking for someone who has experience with:
Facebook & Instagram Ads
Facebook analytics, pixels, custom audiences, power editor, and Ads Manager.
Google AdWords & YouTube Video Ads.
Ability to handle and manage multiple campaigns for multiple clients
Re-Targeting campaigns, building sales funnels, inbound marketing strategy, etc.
Familiar with landing page software like Leadpages, Click Funnels, Wordpress, etc.
Lead nurturing, A/B Testing, Analytics and reporting, and conversion tracking.
Familiar with email marketing software like MailChimp, Klavyio, Active Campaign, etc.
Confident in creating campaigns that will deliver on client business objectives and provide measurable ROI.
Familiar with Google Analytics and other tracking systems.
Most Important of All!
Above all else, we are looking for someone who is willing to go above and beyond their job description when required. (Which is probably going to be often.)
If you need to put together a piece of creative, help another team member for the day, or work on one of our side projects, we need you to be ready and willing. Sometimes your day will run a little late, sometimes you'll have an emergency pop up on a weekend. You need to be willing to play ball and make sure whatever you are responsible for get's done, no excuses.
Basically, we play hard but we work harder. This is not a traditional office job, there is a lot of flexibility and infinite room for growth. You will work, you will learn, but you will have fun! You're joining a family, not a company, and we need someone who truly believes that.
Who We Don't Want
This is not a simple "follow your instructions and keep your head down" type of job. It's hard, it can get confusing, and there can be a lot of pressure, if that's not for you, don't apply. If you get offended when someone gets upset at you, or a client challenges your work, don't apply. If you get offended by constructive criticism or feedback, don't apply. If you get offended a lot in general by a variety of things, please... don't apply. We're a transparent bunch, we'll always tell each other like it is and if we don't our clients will... you need to be someone who can deal with that while keeping up good morale and getting the job done. If you take things personally, or you're over politically correct, you need not apply.
Compensation & Incentives
This is a full-time remote work position, with a salary range of $36,000 to $41,000 per year plus health benefits and a variety of other perks. We're looking for a long term growth minded team member that wants to elevate their career in the marketing industry, and is willing to put in the work over the next 3 to 5 years.
If you think you'd be perfect for this role, apply now!
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $36,000.00-$41,000.00 per year
Additional pay:
Bonus pay
Benefits:
Casual dress
Extended health care
Flexible schedule
Paid time off
Work from home
Schedule:
8 hour shift
COVID-19 considerations:
We do not discriminate against age, gender, race, medical status, vaccinated or not vaccinated, everyone is welcome here. As a work from home position there are no COVID precautions at this time.
Work remotely:
Yes

Title: Director, Digital Marketing - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Profile
Company Profile
Home Capital Group Inc., together with its operating subsidiary Home Trust Company, has developed a track record of success as Canada’s leading alternative lender. Building on the demonstrated strength of its core residential mortgage lending business, the Company also offers complementary lending services, as well as highly competitive deposit investment products. Home Trust’s core values are respect, trust, and integrity.
The Credit Card Business Unit offers innovative credit card products that deliver competitive value to a broad range of Canadians to allow them to access spending power, benefit from consumer loyalty and/ or enhance their credit status while fostering a culture of respect, trust and integrity.
Position Responsibilities
Credit Risk, Customer Analytics and Strategy Design (70%)
Optimize profitability of credit cards/ unsecured lending by designing, recommending and monitoring effective adjudication, account management and collections strategies
Create Test & Learn/ Champion-Challenger strategies to support new policies and products
Perform pro-active portfolio analysis to identify early warning triggers and share with stakeholders
Provide recommendations and support for strategic initiatives based on portfolio trends and consumer insights while collaborating across the organization
Review the unsecured loan portfolio at each phase of credit life cycle (new accounts to collections) and ensure alignment to board approved risk appetite and management limits
Conduct ad-hoc analysis that provide actionable intelligence to improve portfolio understanding and identify opportunities to improve risk/reward trade-offs
Apply statistical analysis to design and validate credit risk strategies and customer segmentation techniques
Influence business decisions by effectively communicating risk performance and early warning trends
Provide regular, timely communication on portfolio trends and insights to support strategic decision making
Maintain a strong working relationship with stakeholder peers and align analytical resources with respect to business targets and priorities
Risk Reporting & Stakeholder Support (30%)
Ensure effective reporting is in place to monitor strategy goals and risk performance within expected outcomes and established portfolio risk appetites
Provide clear, concise and insightful reporting to senior management on relevant matters relating to originations strategies and portfolio performance trends
Enhance portfolio insight and management decision-making through the use of leading edge analytics, methods and tools for the early detection of opportunities, trends and anomalies
Identify areas of opportunity to consolidate and streamline reporting activities and infrastructure
Liaise across the business to help identify opportunities to maximize risk/return trade-off
Identify opportunities to enhance underwriting standards to reflect sound business practices
Ensure data integrity of all analytical work and results
Formal Education
Bachelor's degree required in Business, Economics, Finance or equivalent
Related Experience
Related Experience:
Minimum 10 years related experience in credit risk analytics in a financial institution, ideally in a Credit Cards business
Practical knowledge of leading industry practices in designing risk strategies for retail lending products, especially unsecured credit cards
Sound and practical knowledge of credit card origination, account management and collection strategy design and implementation
Experience in data mining, segmentation and statistical model development
Experience with development of strategies utilizing credit risk scores
Skills:
Excellent organizational and time-management skills to balance, prioritize workload and deliver effective results within established guidelines (e.g. balancing and re-prioritizing multiple projects, responsibilities and deadlines)
Entrepreneurial, comfortable to operate at various levels and willing to “roll-up-your-sleeves”
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
Familiar with Fair Isaac products such as Triad
Understanding of Credit Bureau files and associated data elements
Effective project management and leadership capabilities to handle and deliver on projects with minimal direction
Excellent written / verbal communication and professional maturity, strong presentation skills and able to explain complex technical concepts to business partners who are non-technical
Flourishes in a fast-paced, deadline-driven work environment
Solid knowledge of MS Office, Cognos and programming (SAS, SQL)
Skills
Position Complexities
Acknowledgement
Some work beyond standard hours may be required.
This role requires access to confidential, sensitive personal information about Home Trust’s customers (as permitted by Home Trust’s credit agreements) in order to effectively assess and evaluate current and potential credit risks. The incumbent acknowledges that such information is to be used solely for Home Trust’s business purposes.
All employees of Home Capital Group Inc. must comply with all applicable Home Capital Group Inc, Home Trust Company, and specific Line of Business policies, standards, guidelines and controls. Additionally, all employees are obligated to become familiar with Home’s risk management framework and understand the operational risk management requirements within their specific business. Employees are also expected to understand and comply with the Company’s Code of Business Conduct & Ethics Policy at all times and escalate any issues or concerns through various reporting channels (i.e. Ombudsman, Compliance Hotline, Whistleblower Policy, etc).
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Email Marketing Specialist - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
About Borrowell:
Borrowell is a Canadian company dedicated to making financial stability possible for everyone. The first to offer free credit scores, Borrowell provides educational resources, monitoring, innovative digital tools and personalized product recommendations to help people feel in control and optimistic about their financial future. In previous data, members using Borrowell reported up to 100 points increased to their credit score after 1 year with select Borrowell products.
With 2 million members and $102 million in funding since 2017, Borrowell is one of the largest fintech companies in Canada. Borrowell has won numerous awards, including being named one of Globe and Mail’s Top Growing Companies, LinkedIn’s Top Startups in Canada, CB Insights’ Top 250 Fintechs, and Best Workplaces in Financial Services & Insurance.
Borrowell places a high value on building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is proud to have a gender-balanced team. Borrowell was named one of the Top 50 Best Workplaces in Canada, as well as one of the Best Workplaces for Women, and Mental Wellness.
About the role:
As the Email Marketing Specialist, you will work with the Engagement Manager & Partnerships Team to create and implement affiliate marketing campaigns for Borrowell’s almost 2 million member base.
As a key member of the Revenue and Engagement teams, the individual will own our affiliate marketing channel for Borrowell’s marketplace. This involves providing strategic direction, channel optimization, campaign planning, execution, and reporting.
Responsibilities:
Build email & push notification marketing campaigns, segment audiences, recommend test strategies, and ensure high quality of all outbound campaigns
Collaborate with Engagement Manager to define & execute on evolving strategy of the Affiliate Email channel
Coordinate with Borrowell partners to understand business requirements and ensure all email campaign assets are delivered on time and follow Borrowell best practices and guidelines
Own the campaign deployment calendar to ensure campaigns are on track and executed on time
Coordinate with internal marketing teams (including Growth, Visual Design, and Content Marketing) to develop campaign content
Develop strong relationships with external partners and internal team members
Assist in identifying new opportunities for using and acquiring data to better meet the needs of our partners
Assist in creating & executing sponsorship opportunities to further deepen partner relationships
Produce partner-facing performance reports and continually look for insights to improve future campaign performance
Requirements
2+ years experience with enterprise-level email service providers (Salesforce Marketing Cloud - preferred, Hubspot, Sendgrid, etc.)
1+ years of client-facing experience, leading campaign discussions and managing client expectations
Knowledge of customer engagement, with experience in email best practices, as well as methods for testing and optimization
Ability to prioritize effectively and quantify the impact of work
Excellent communication both written and verbally, along with strong presentation skills
Strong attention to detail and adaptability
Comfortable with data visualization and KPI tracking
Nice to Haves:
Experience with Looker, Tableau or other data visualization tools
Basic understanding of SQL for audience segmentation
Experience working in a scaling startup
Benefits
The Opportunity
- join and have a major impact at a growing company that is helping make financial stability possible for everybody
Comprehensive Health Benefits
- medical, dental, vision, and paramedical health benefits for you and your family, with extra yearly coverage for psychotherapists and massage therapists
Additional Health Benefits
- virtual benefit offering that allows you to connect 24/7 with nurses, doctors and mental health professionals
Maternity & Parental Leave Top-up
- available to new parents
Wellness Benefit
- $600 annually to spend on whatever brings you joy
WFH Reimbursement
- we ship you gear like a laptop, mouse, keyboard, and you can reimburse additional items to make your workplace better for you
Employee Development Benefit
- annual reimbursements on payments to help your learning
Givewell Benefit
- 1 paid volunteer day a year to give back to the community
Flexibility
- flexible working hours and a flexible vacation policy
We are remote-first across Canada, meaning you have no mandatory obligation to come in-office unless you choose to do so - you decide what is best for you. Our offices are located in Toronto, Kelowna, and Montreal, with teams distributed primarily in Ontario and BC.
At Borrowell, one of our core values and firm beliefs is that diversity makes us better. If you’re unsure about your qualifications for this position, we’d still encourage you to apply. We’re looking for candidates who have experience but know that not everyone’s had a chance to demonstrate what they can do. What’s most important is that you have a growth mindset and care about helping people with their finances - an area in their lives that causes a lot of stress.
Please note that due to the sensitive nature of the work we do, clearing a credit and criminal record check is a condition of employment.
Borrowell encourages applications from candidates with differing abilities. Please let us know if you require accommodation at any stage in the selection process.
Job Type: Full-time
